protocol_name: Wet-lab identification of Leishmania donovani antigens detected by human IgG1
protocol_name_html: Wet-lab identification of Leishmania donovani antigens detected by human IgG1
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"nfbh","text":"This protocol describes a wet-lab method to identify Leishmania proteins bands recognized by human IgG1. The cytosolic proteins obtained by cell lysis are initially separated by tricine gel electrophoresis using a long (14 cm) apparatus (SG-200, CBS Scientific, USA). Upon completion of the gel electrophoresis, the proteins are transferred onto a nitrocellulose (NC) membrane (10600046, GE Healthcare Life Sciences, UK) using a semi-dry electroblotting transfer system (1703940, Bio-Rad, UK). The NC membrane is sliced into several thin (4mm) strips and each of the strip is immunoassayed with individual sera from Indian patients with different clinical status of visceral leishmaniasis - VL (active VL, relapse, endemic healthy controls and non-endemic healthy controls) using an HRP-conjugated anti-human IgG1 secondary antibody (ab99774, Abcam, Cambridge, UK)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"9kkaj","text":"Tris, tricine, SDS, HCl, acrylamide, bisacrylamide, amonium persulphate, TEMED, dH2O,  glycerol, Coomassie blue G-250, PBS,  acetic acid, non-fat milk powder, Tween 20, mouse anti-human IgG1-HRP monoclonal antibody, SigmaFast DAB tablets","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"6r5k2","text":"Acrylamide and bisacrylamide are highly neurotoxic. When handling these chemicals, wear gloves, use a pipetting aid and always work under the hood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_affiliation: University of Antwerp, Coris BioConcept,London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine, University of London
manuscript_citation: Schägger H. Tricine-SDS-PAGE. Nat Protoc. 2006;1(1):16-22. doi: 10.1038/nprot.2006.4. PMID: 17406207.

authors_list.name: Tegwen Marlais
authors_list.affiliation: London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine, University of London

authors_list.name: Stephanie Airs
authors_list.affiliation: London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine, University of London

status_info:
We use this protocol in our group and it is working.
Small changes (wording) and details might follow. Protocol was already applied multiple times

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"c8gs9","text":"Prepare 10x solutions of cathode buffer (Tris 1M, Tricine 1M, SDS 1%, pH ~8,25) and anode buffer (Tris 1M, HCl 0.225M, pH 8.9)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"EAF12DB0DE0411E8BB16EB503EF63FA3","id":678721,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1s9lh","text":"Prepare an acrylamide-bisacrylamide (AB-3) stock solution by dissolving 48 g of acrylamide and 1.5g of bisacrylamide (each twice-crystallized; Serva) in 100 ml of water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"EECF5240DE0411E8BB16EB503EF63FA3","id":678722,"previous_id":678721,"previous_guid":"EAF12DB0DE0411E8BB16EB503EF63FA3","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"buek5","text":"Prepare a 3x gel buffer solution (Tris 3M, HCl 1M, SDS 0,3%, pH 8,45)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F11CEBC0DE0411E8BB16EB503EF63FA3","id":678723,"previous_id":678722,"previous_guid":"EECF5240DE0411E8BB16EB503EF63FA3","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7li9f","text":"Upon gel completion, disassemble the gel apparatus and remove the stacking gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F96A2A40DE0411E8BB16EB503EF63FA3","id":678724,"previous_id":678723,"previous_guid":"9B7CCEC0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein transfer"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9p7n","text":"Cover the transfer system with the lid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"19D25E60DE0511E8BB16EB503EF63FA3","id":678725,"previous_id":678724,"previous_guid":"BAE37160DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein transfer"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7is1c","text":"Upon completion of the protein transfer, block the membrane with blocking buffer (PBS + 3% w\/v non-fat milk powder overnight at 4\u00b0C followed by three 5 minute washes in PBST (PBS + 0,05% Tween 20) and one wash of PBST + 0.02% w\/v sodium azide","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"35B53170DE0511E8BB16EB503EF63FA3","id":678727,"previous_id":678725,"previous_guid":"FAC24DB0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"157am","text":"Add enough mouse anti-human IgG1-HRP (ab99774, Abcam, UK) diluted 1:1000 in blocking buffer to cover the strips","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"D9B1C110DEA711E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678891,"previous_guid":"0A1BE640DEA911E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pj6c","text":"To prepare 20ml of a 10% resolving gel solution, mix 4ml of AB-3, 6.66ml of 3x gel buffer solution and 9.33ml of dH2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":115,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E0B393D0DEA711E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678892,"previous_guid":"F11CEBC0DE0411E8BB16EB503EF63FA3","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hgu8","text":"Store the gel overnight with a dH2O overlay at 4oC. Cover the top of the gel with a plastic film to minimise evaporation ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":33,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":48,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E3961A50DEA711E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678893,"previous_guid":"E5441870DEA711E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3aqk1","text":"Pour the 10% resolving gel solution into the gel apparatus\u00a0with a pipette, leaving a space of about\u00a0the height of the comb that will be used + 1,5cm\u00a0(where the 4% stacking gel will be later casted)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E5441870DEA711E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678894,"previous_guid":"E6DA6FE0DEA711E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bjjbo","text":"Add the polymerising agents: 100 \u00b5l of 10% amonium persulphate\u00a0(APS)\u00a0and 10 \u00b5l of TEMED ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E6DA6FE0DEA711E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678895,"previous_guid":"E0B393D0DEA711E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7t5g","text":"Store the gel at 4oC until complete solidification of the stacking gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":18,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"1FD7D2B0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678896,"previous_guid":"2255CB00DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45kv1","text":"Directly insert the\u00a0comb (avoid the formation of air bubbles underneath the comb)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"2255CB00DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678897,"previous_guid":"23B11540DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3hf2u","text":"Pour the 4% stacking gel solution into the gel apparatus\u00a0with a pippete\u00a0(onto the top of the resolving gel, now solidified)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"23B11540DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678898,"previous_guid":"24EC7B70DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23dle","text":"Add the polymerising agents: 67.5 \u00b5l of 10%\u00a0APS solutions and 6.75 \u00b5l of TEMED ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"af9o5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"24EC7B70DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678899,"previous_guid":"268DCF60DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8q0jr","text":"On the following day, carefully pour off the dH2O on the top of the (now solidified resolving gel) and prepare about 4 ml of a 4% stacking gel solution by mixing 0.33ml of AB-3, 1ml of gel buffer 3x and 2,67ml of dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":47,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":215,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"268DCF60DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678900,"previous_guid":"E3961A50DEA711E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93vcp","text":"Mount the gel electrophoresis apparatus and fill the cathode and anode tanks with 1x cathode and anode buffer, respectively","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"4C419AC0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678901,"previous_guid":"4DF4A1F0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4finr","text":"Prepare the samples to be loaded into the wells by mixing 3 parts of L. donovani lysate with 1 part of non-reducing sample buffer (2% SDS (wt\/vol), 30% glycerol (wt\/vol), 0.05% Coomassie blue G-250 (Serva), 150 mM Tris\/HCl (pH 7.0). The final L. donovani concentration should be 4 \u00b5g\/mm lane. Depending on the initial concentration of the L. donovani lysate, use PBS to dilute it to a final total protein load of 4 \u00b5g\/mm lane","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":69,"length":11,"style":"italic"},{"offset":243,"length":11,"style":"italic"},{"offset":339,"length":11,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"4DF4A1F0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678902,"previous_guid":"4F012FF0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"69u2i","text":"Carefully rinse the wells multiple times with dH20.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":48,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"4F012FF0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678903,"previous_guid":"5013D870DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c1ab5","text":"Carefully\u00a0and slowly\u00a0remove the comb in order to avoid damaging\u00a0to\u00a0the stacking gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"5013D870DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678904,"previous_guid":"1FD7D2B0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"arjn1","text":"Load the wells with the samples and protein molecular weight marker (1610374, Bio-Rad, UK)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"96E25F10DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678905,"previous_guid":"4C419AC0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7cl3","text":"Run the gel at 30V constant for 55min, then 120V constant for a total of 5h","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"9B7CCEC0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678906,"previous_guid":"96E25F10DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein separation by tricine SDS-PAGE"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1te83","text":"Squeeze out air bubbles by gently rolling any cylindrical object\u00a0(e.g. a Falcon tube)\u00a0against the top layer of blotting paper","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"BAE37160DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678907,"previous_guid":"BC4CC560DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein transfer"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eblf0","text":"Add four layers of blotting paper previously soaked with blotting buffer on the top of the gel. Add more blotting buffer if necessary. Do not flood the system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"BC4CC560DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678908,"previous_guid":"BD6ADF90DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein transfer"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d49ql","text":"Carefully add the gel on the top of the NC membrane. Ensure full contact between gel and NC membrane along the whole surface","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"BD6ADF90DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678909,"previous_guid":"BE8920D0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein transfer"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89fp1","text":"Add the NC membrane (10600046, GE Healthcare Life Sciences, UK) on the top of the soaked blotting paper","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"BE8920D0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678910,"previous_guid":"BFC1EEF0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein transfer"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vj73","text":"Soak three layers of blotting paper (Whatman GB005) with blotting buffer (300 mM Tris, 100 mM acetic acid (pH 8.6). Do not flood the semi-dry system (1703940, Bio-Rad, UK)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"BFC1EEF0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678911,"previous_guid":"F96A2A40DE0411E8BB16EB503EF63FA3","section":"Protein transfer"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bkgo1","text":"Upon completion of the transfer, air dry the membranes. Place heavy objects onto\u00a0the\u00a0four\u00a0corners of the membrane,\u00a0to avoid curling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"FAC24DB0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678912,"previous_guid":"FC099AC0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Protein transfer"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6971l","text":"Run for 120 minutes at constant 60 mA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"FC099AC0DEA811E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678913,"previous_guid":"19D25E60DE0511E8BB16EB503EF63FA3","section":"Protein transfer"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7c4d6","text":"Wash the strips with PBST six times for 10 minutes each","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"0A1BE640DEA911E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678914,"previous_guid":"0B59E480DEA911E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1q5ij","text":"Incubate at rocking for 1h at room temperature (RT)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"0B59E480DEA911E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678915,"previous_guid":"0CA74C10DEA911E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2u7nb","text":"Add enough serum samples diluted 1:400 in blocking buffer to cover the strips","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"0CA74C10DEA911E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678916,"previous_guid":"0DE28B30DEA911E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fom25","text":"Pre-wet the individual strips with PBS and place them in wells of an 8-well immunotray (octa-101, Pateof, Denmark)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"0DE28B30DEA911E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678917,"previous_guid":"0F17AFD0DEA911E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acpkr","text":"Number the strips sequentially (including the MWM). Store in airtight containers at 4oC until use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":85,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"0F17AFD0DEA911E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678918,"previous_guid":"12878230DEA911E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qub0","text":"Tape the top of the membrane (for identification, see step below) and slice the blocked NC membrane into 4 mm strips using a paper trimmer (Cathedral Products, UK)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"12878230DEA911E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678919,"previous_guid":"35B53170DE0511E8BB16EB503EF63FA3","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aqr5n","text":"To reveal the protein bands, dissolve 1 tablet pair of SigmaFast DAB (D0426, Sigma-Aldrich) in 15ml of dH2O immediately prior to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":105,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"99CA51E0DEAA11E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678922,"previous_guid":"9B34DE60DEAA11E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"difjr","text":"Wash the strips with PBST six times for 10 minutes each","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"9B34DE60DEAA11E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678923,"previous_guid":"9CB60020DEAA11E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ter1","text":"Incubate at rocking for 1h at RT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"9CB60020DEAA11E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678924,"previous_guid":"D9B1C110DEA711E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1dpkp","text":"Wash thoroughly with water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"AC0A1A70DEAA11E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678925,"previous_guid":"AD76C9D0DEAA11E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9stm0","text":"Add enough volume to cover the strips and incubate for 4 minutes in darkness","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"AD76C9D0DEAA11E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678926,"previous_guid":"99CA51E0DEAA11E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9paiu","text":"Air-dry the strips with heavy objects on top and bottom to avoid curling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B5818110DEAA11E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","id":678927,"previous_guid":"AC0A1A70DEAA11E8A541FD8F285B8BA5","section":"Immunoassay"}
